definition: awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: And character, in the words of Heraclitus, determines fate.
sentences.chinese: 赫拉克利特曾经说过，性格决定命运。

sentences.english: They told me, Heraclitus , they told me you were dead.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诉我，赫拉克利特，他们说你已经死去。

sentences.english: He was known as Weeping Philosopher and Heraclitus the Obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他被人称为哭泣的哲学家和难以理解的赫拉克利特。

sentences.english: This concept originated in Heraclitus, who was much admired by Nietzsche.
sentences.chinese: 这个概念源自赫拉克利特，他备受尼采的推崇。

definition: Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
Empedocles (490-430 BC), Greek Sicilian pre-Socratic philosopher
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
neo-Platonism (philosophical system combining Platonism with mysticism)
pinyin: xin1 Bo2 la1 tu2 zhu3 yi4
